document.text: Negro H it by Unknown Man Pamplin City, Va., March 12 What seems to have been an attempt at murder was revealed when the negro named Couch, who was found unconscious early Sunday morning at the switch just east of the depot, regained consciousness for a short time last night and told how he received the injury which almost caused him to lose his life. He sought lodg ing Saturday night at the house of an unknown negro. After he gained admittance he became involved in a quarrel with this negro, who struck him with a blunt instrument, rendering him unconscious. It is suppos ed that his assailant then car ried the unconscious negro to the railroad, in order that a train might finish his task and have it appear as an accident.
